title: Bug 104630 - Column icons don't show up in connecting Derby database
OB: Column icons are not displayed in the Data Explorer view when connecting to a Derby database. The icons that typically indicate column properties or characteristics are missing.
EB: Column icons should be visible in the Data Explorer view when connecting to a Derby database. These icons provide valuable information about the properties of each column, aiding users in understanding and working with the database schema.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new project.
2. Generate a new report.
3. In the Data Explorer view, establish a new Data Source to connect to a Derby database with the following details:
   - Driver Class: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver
   - Database URL: jdbc:db2://spmdb:1527/gui
   - User Name: root
   - Password: root
4. After configuring the Data Source, create a dataset.
5. In the 'Edit Data Set' window, select 'Query.'
6. Observe that the column icons, indicating column properties, are not displayed in the Data Explorer view.
